item.description:
My research primarily focuses on problems in Computer Vision. I am particulary interested in investigating approaches for locating and identifying semantic concepts (objects, parts, actions, and other useful human concepts) in visual signals, while minimizing human effort (supervision) and scaling up the learned visual taxonomies (vocabulary size).

I received a PhD in Robotics from Carnegie Mellon University, where I was advised by Abhinav Gupta. In the past, some of the problems I have worked on include self-supervised representation learning, few-shot & zero-shot learning, object detection, semantic segmentation, visual physics modeling and 3D modeling via audio-visual cues. If you are interested in any of these topics or my recent work, checkout my projects below!
